column1: It was in vain to sit still and wish for what was not to be had; and this extremity roused my application. We had several spare yards
column2: and two or three large spars of wood
column3: and a spare topmast or two in the ship; I resolved to fall to work with these
column4: and I flung as many of them overboard as I could manage for their weight
column5: tying every one with a rope
column6: that they might not drive away. When this was done I went down the ship's side
column8: I tied four of them together at both ends as well as I could
column9: in the form of a raft
column10: and laying two or three short pieces of plank upon them crossways
column11: I found I could walk upon it very well
column12: but that it was not able to bear any great weight
column13: the pieces being too light. So I went to work
column14: and with a carpenter's saw I cut a spare topmast into three lengths
column15: and added them to my raft
column16: with a great deal of labor and pains.
